gurmukhi: dyv sbY qRwisq Bey mn moN kIXo ibcwr ]
transliteration: Dev Sabai Traasit Bhae Man Mon Kooyo Bichaar||
translation: All the gods were filled with fear and thought in their mind;

gurmukhi: srn BvwnI kI sBY Bwij pry inrDwr ]8]46]
transliteration: Saran Bhavaanoo Koo Sabhai Bhaaj(i) Dare Nirdhaar||8||46||
translation: Being helpless, they all ran to come under the refuge of the goddess.8.46.

gurmukhi: su qRws dyv BwjIAM ]bsyK lwj lwjIAM ]
transliteration: Su Traas Dev Bhaajooan|| Basekh Laaj Laajooan||
translation: The gods ran in great fear and felt ashamed with particular self-abasment.

gurmukhi: ibisK kwrmM ksy ]su dyv lok mo bsy ]9]47]
transliteration: Bisikh Kaaramannd Kase|| Su Dev Lok Mo Base||9||47||
translation: They had fitted poisonous shafts in their bows and in this way they went ot reside in the city of goddess.9.47.

gurmukhi: qbY pRkop dyb huAY ]clI su ssqR AsqR lY ]
transliteration: Tabai Prakop Deb Huai|| Chaloo Su Sastra Astra Lai||
translation: Then the goddess was filled with great rage and marched towards the battlefield with her weapons and arms.

gurmukhi: su mu`d pwn pwn kY ]gjI kiRpwn pwn lY ]10]48]
transliteration: Su Mudd Paan Paan Kai|| Gadoo Kridaan Paan Lai||10||48||
translation: She drank the nectar in ther delight and roared wihile taking the sword in her hand.10.48.

transliteration: Sounoo Dev Baanoo|| Chadoo Singh Raanoo||
translation: Listening to the talk of the gods, the queen (goddess) munted the lion.

transliteration: Soubhan Sastra Dhdare|| Sabhai Paap Tdare||11||49||
translation: She had worn all her auspicious weapons and she is the one who effaces all the sins.11.49.

transliteration: Daro Nadd Naadan|| Mahaan Madd Maadan||
translation: The goddess commanded that highly inebriating trumpets besounded.

transliteration: Bhayo Sankh Soran|| Sounyo Chaar Oran||12||50||
translation: Then the conches created great noise, which was heard. In all the four directions.12.50.

transliteration: Oute Dait Dhaae|| Badoo Sainn Liaae||
translation: The demons marched forward and brought great forces.
Their faces and eyes were red like blood and they shouted prickig words.13.51.
